catch_line: Notifying Hotel Workers Of Their Potential Right To The Federal Earned Income Credit.
full_text:
NOTIFYING HOTEL WORKERS OF THEIR POTENTIAL RIGHT TO THE FEDERAL EARNED INCOME CREDIT.

	Hotel Employers shall inform Hotel Workers making less than $12 per hour of their possible right to the federal Earned Income Credit (EIC) under Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, 26 U.S.C. Section 32, and shall make available to Hotel Workers forms informing them about the EIC and forms required to secure advance EIC payments from the Hotel Employer.

3.catch_line: Payment Of Minimum Compensation To Hotel Workers.

6.catch_line: Notifying Hotel Workers Of Their Potential Right To The Federal Earned Income Credit.

plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE

NOTIFYING HOTEL WORKERS OF THEIR POTENTIAL RIGHT TO THE FEDERAL EARNED INCOME
CREDIT. (§ 104.107)

  NOTIFYING HOTEL WORKERS OF THEIR POTENTIAL RIGHT TO THE FEDERAL EARNED INCOME
CREDIT.	Hotel Employers shall inform Hotel Workers making less than $12 per hour
of their possible right to the federal Earned Income Credit (EIC) under Section
32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954, 26 U.S.C. Section 32, and shall make
available to Hotel Workers forms informing them about the EIC and forms required
to secure advance EIC payments from the Hotel Employer.
